comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: www.sacred-destinations.com/egypt/abu-simbel-pictures/sli... Abu Simbel inner shrine seated statues that illuminate from sunrise at certain times of the year - Ra-Horakhty (Horus & Ra, God of rising sun), Ptah (opener, sunrise, boatman of the dead), Amun (the King of all Gods) and Ramesses or Ramses The Great (Ramses II) This image is frequently seen posted on other sites backwards or flipped. On certain days towards the end of February and October the sun's rays reach deep into the inner shrine, and illuminate this shrine wall. Great descriptions of various Egyptian Gods here: www.ancientegypt.co.uk/gods/explore/main.html

comment.author: 24141292@N02
comment._content:
Actually this image is reversed, Ptah should be on the left and Ra-Horakhty on the right, within Amun and Ramses seated between them.
These are great historic images, an especially good record since they pre-date the relocation of the temples in the 60s and 70s.

comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content:
Yes, this image seems to be a 'flipper'  - It is extraordinary to see the images, not too long after the Western World discovered them.  Sometimes the older images are even better for details we miss. 
Thanks for the clarification.

comment.author: 88342028@N00
comment._content: Thanks for letting us know that the image was flipped. We're editing the master file and will upload the replacement soon. Deborah Wythe

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: confirmed - new image is now up - many thanks!
